solution_line_template: In the full decks, John has a total of {cards_per_deck} cards in a full deck of cards * {num_full_decks} full decks of cards = <<{cards_per_deck}*{num_full_decks}={full_deck_cards}>>{full_deck_cards} cards.
A half-full deck of cards contains {cards_per_deck} cards in a full deck of cards / {half_deck_divisor} = <<{cards_per_deck}/{half_deck_divisor}={half_deck_cards}>>{half_deck_cards} cards.

So from the half-full decks, John has a total of {half_deck_cards} cards * {num_half_decks} half-full decks = <<{half_deck_cards}*{num_half_decks}={total_half_deck_cards}>>{total_half_deck_cards} cards.
This is a total of {full_deck_cards} cards from full decks + {total_half_deck_cards} cards from half-full decks = <<{full_deck_cards}+{total_half_deck_cards}={total_cards}>>{total_cards} cards.
After throwing some in the trash, he now holds a total of {total_cards} cards - {trashed_cards} trashed cards = <<{total_cards}-{trashed_cards}={remaining_cards}>>{remaining_cards} cards.
